entry.et: Middle English, from Old English bæth; akin to Old High German bad bath, Old High German bāen to warm

def.dt: :a washing or soaking (as in water or steam) of all or part of the body
:water used for bathing
:a contained liquid for a special purpose
:a receptacle holding the liquid
:a medium for regulating the temperature of something placed in or on it
:a vessel containing this medium
:bathroom
:a building containing an apartment or a series of rooms designed for bathing
:spa 1 usually used in plural
:swimming pool often used in plural
:the quality or state of being covered with a liquid
:flood 3
:bathtub
:a financial setback :loss took a bath in the market
:to give a bath to
:to take a bath
:an ancient Hebrew liquid measure corresponding to the ephah of dry measure
city SW England in Somerset pop 79,900
:a hooded and sometimes glassed wheeled chair used especially by invalids
:wheelchair
:a usually washable mat used in a bathroom
:a usually colored crystalline compound for perfuming and softening bathwater
:a bathroom containing a sink and toilet but no bathtub or shower
:shower 4
